Job Posting:173658 - Position: W26 Data Science Co-op 173658 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/01/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 09/22/2025 03:09 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City ICBC Insurance Corporation of British Columbia 151 Esplanade W North Vancouver Postal Code / Zip Code V7M3H9 Province / State Country British Columbia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Data Science Co-op 173658 Co-op Position North Vancouver, BC Canada 4 or 8 months Hybrid CAD 26.86 per hour for 37.5 Major List 26.86 + 11.2% in lieu of Stat/Vacation *Please fill out the Co-op questionnaire as a part of your application from the Additional Application Information * About ICBC ICBC is one of BC's largest corporations and one of Canada's largest property and casualty (P&C) insurers with annual earned premiums of $6.0 billion and $17.5 billion in assets. We are driven to ensuring the well-being of drivers while working to keep rates low, delivering excellent service consistently, and proactively partnering to reduce crashes. We are a dynamic and forward-thinking organization dedicated to leveraging data-driven insights to fuel our business strategies and decisions. ICBC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Position Highlights We are currently looking for a student to complete a Coop term or internship working with the Data Science Team in the Strategic Analytics department. Your responsibilities will include: • gaining deep understanding of relevant business processes, opportunities and challenges, • collaborating with your colleagues to design and create quality data products, • using your skills and creativity to solve difficult technical problems As part of this Coop term, you will be expected to contribute your skills and knowledge during the completion of one or more projects working with structured and unstructured text data. The work will be completed in close collaboration with members of the Data Science Team to facilitate knowledge sharing and skill development. The nature and scope of the project(s) will be adjusted to reflect the interests and capabilities of the successful applicant as well as the strategic priorities of the corporation. Job Requirements Position Requirements You are completing, a graduate degree in a relevant field that may include computer science, computational linguistics, or statistics, and which has included working with text or other unstructured data. You have strong communication and collaboration skills, and can think critically and creatively when confronted with new and uncertain analytical challenges. A familiarity with python is required; familiarity with Apache Spark will be considered and asset. This position resides out of the North Vancouver head office and includes a hybrid work model. Salary: $26.86 + 11.2% (in lieu of vacation/stats) N/A Citizenship Requirement Position Start Date Position End Date January 05, 2026 12:00 AM April 30, 2026 12:00 AM APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Please submit an additional PDF document answering the questions below: 1) "Persons with disabilities" means persons who have a long-term or recurring physical, mental, sensory, psychiatric, or learning impairment, and who a) consider themselves to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, or b) believe that an employer or potential employer is likely to consider them to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, and includes persons whose functional limitations owing to their impairment have been accommodated in their current job or workplace. Examples of what is considered a disability include, but are not limited to, the following impairments or issues relating to: Coordination or dexterity (difficulty using hands or arms); Mobility (difficulty moving around and may include severe back problems); Non-visible, physical conditions such as: heart problems, chronic pain, diabetes, epilepsy, asthma, glaucoma, and lupus; Hearing and visual; Speech, such as muteness; and difficulty speaking and being understood; Learning, such as: Dyslexia; Mental or psychiatric such as: depression and burn-out; A disability for which the employer provided an accommodation. Based on this definition, do you identify as a person with a disability? Yes or No We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers.
